captions.text:
- THIS WEEK, I'VE BEEN TALKING
ABOUT A LOT OF THINGS

THAT HAPPENED
WHILE WE WERE ON OUR BREAK.

THERE WERE TWO THINGS
THAT BROKE MY HEART.

JOAN RIVERS
PASSED AWAY LAST WEEK.

SHE HAD AN INCREDIBLY LONG,
SUCCESSFUL CAREER,

AND YET SHE STILL LOST--
LEFT US TOO SOON.

AND OF COURSE,
WE LOST ROBIN WILLIAMS.

EVERY TIME HE WAS HERE,
HE MADE ME LAUGH SO HARD.
HE WAS REALLY ONE OF A KIND,

AND I'M THANKFUL
THAT I GOT TO CALL HIM A FRIEND.

THERE IS NO ONE IN THE WORLD
QUITE LIKE OUR FIRST GUEST.

PLEASE WELCOME THE ONE,
THE ONLY, ROBIN WILLIAMS.

'CAUSE YOU'RE A SKY
FULL OF STARS

- AND WE'RE OFF.
- AND WE'RE OFF!

- 'CAUSE THE LAST TIME
YOU WERE HERE,

YOU GAVE ME A CASE
OF YOUR WINE.

- WE SENT IT TO YOU.
- IT'S YOUR WINE.

YOU KNOW, BUT I--
SITTING THERE GOING,

I ACTUALLY HAD A WOMAN
WAXING ME ONCE.

"DO YOU MIND
IF I TAKE A BREAK?"

I HAVEN'T SEEN YOU
SINCE YOUR HEART SURGERY.

THERE IS THAT WEIRD THING
THAT, YOU KNOW,

YOU DON'T MIX HEART SURGERY
AND VIAGRA.

NOT A GOOD COMBO.
- NO, NO.

I GUESS I BETTER TAKE
A LITTLE SIP OF COFFEE NOW.

OUR FIRST GUEST WAS BORN
RIGHT HERE IN CHICAGO.

- NICE TO BE HERE, ELLEN.
OR IS IT HELEN?

- THERE'S A LOT
OF DIFFERENT ACCENTS--

- THERE'S A LOT
OF ACCENTS HERE,

BUT YOU GET
YOUR BASIC CHICAGO ACCENT.

LET ME GET YOU SOME KIELBASI,
FOR THE FOLKS RIGHT THERE.

AND THEN WE WENT TO PARIS
FOR THE HONEYMOON.

- OH, THAT'S BEAUTIFUL.
- OH, IT'S AMAZING.

"SIRI, NAME ME
A FINE FRENCH RESTAURANT."

WALK DOWN A BLOCK.
LOOK AROUND, YOU IDIOT."

- CAN WE SHOW PICTURES
OF YOUR CUTE LITTLE DOGGY

- OH, THERE'S THE CAT
AND THE PUG.

WE TAKE THEM FOR A WALK
EVERY DAY.

AND IT'S WEIRD TO SEE
ANOTHER DOG WALK BY

AND SEE THE DOG AND GO,
"WHAT'S UP?"

AND THEN THE DOG SEES THE CAT
AND GOES, "WHAT THE HELL?"

MAY YOUR CHILD GROW UP
AND HAVE A LOT OF FACIAL HAIR.

MAY YOUR DAUGHTER
HAVE A MUSTACHE LIKE MY AUNT.

BEEN THE GOVERNOR NOW
FOR THE SECOND TERM.

I'M SO EXCITED
TO BE BACK.

HAVE A DRINK,
AND FORGET ABOUT VOTING.

- [in Native accent]
IT IS A GOOD THING

THAT YOU HAVE COME HERE,
BECAUSE I HAVE SNIFFLE-IS.

WHERE YOU GET
YOUR SENSE OF HUMOR.

WHEN YOU'RE A COMEDY,
PEOPLE SAY, "HOW DO YOU--

WHAT HAPPENED?
WERE YOU FUNNY AS A KID?"

AND YOU GET IT
FROM YOUR MOM.

IS THAT WHAT YOU SAID?
- YEAH, VERY MUCH SO.

IT'S THAT PRIMAL THING
THAT LENNY BRUCE TALKED ABOUT.

THE FIRST--YOUR FIRST AUDIENCE,
AND THE REALLY NECESSARY ONE,

THAT'S WHY THEY MAKE BABIES
REAL CUTE.

comments.text:
I'm watching this in May 2015, and I've probably watched it about 50 times 
prior, but I keep crying. He was such a character, he was such a comedian, 
he was himself. There isn't a soul out there like our Robbin Williams. I 
miss this guy so much!

Thank you for everything! Without you I wouldn't have had as many laughs, 
as many tears and as many loving moments!

Thank you for my childhood.

Hxoxoxoxoxo﻿

comments.author: Meinytr n

comments.text:
I didn't know him, but I know how he made me feel every time I watched one 
of his movies. I haven't been able to watch Aladdin, Jumanji, Patch Adams, 
Hook, Night at the Museum, or any of his other movies since I heard of his 
passing over eight months ago. I miss him a lot and when I watch movies 
that were made after his death, I can't help but think about which 
character he would have played. I hope you are Resting In Peace Robin. 
Thank you for all the times you made me smile.﻿

comments.text:
Whenever I see some old video of Robin Williams I can't help but to 
remember the Pagliacci joke: Man goes to doctor. Says he's depressed. Says 
life seems harsh and cruel. Says he feels all alone in a threatening world 
where what lies ahead is vague and uncertain. Doctor says, "Treatment is 
simple. Great clown Pagliacci is in town tonight. Go and see him. That 
should pick you up." Man bursts into tears. Says, "But doctor...I am 
Pagliacci.﻿

comments.text:
For the final time yes Robin committed suicide but no it wasn't due to 
illicit drugs. He had Parkinson disease which cause the person with the 
disease severe depression and he also had lewd body dementia disorder. 
Combined they caused him to sink into a severe depression that caused him 
to commit suicide. Most wonder if he wasn't a maniac depressive which is 
define from going from severe depression to moments of maniac energy very 
much the way Robin acted is the way they define maniac depression.﻿

comments.author: Gemma Westover

comments.text:
I was at a summer camp in another province training kids when I found out 
Robin  had died. I walked into the staff room and on the television it read 
"Robin Williams commits suicide". I stood in shock for a while and didn't 
know what to do. My whole life I'd done projects on him, watched his 
movies, everything. I idolized the man because he always wanted to make 
others happy, just like I did. I didn't know what to do so I called my mom 
and started to cry. All I could say was "Robin Williams is dead" and 
continue to cry. My mother thought at first I'd fallen for a hoax and 
looked it up and remained in complete silence for minutes as I cried over 
the phone. I remember saying to her when I was little "Mom, it's going to 
suck the day he dies" and she said "Don't ever say that". He helped me get 
through so much with my ADHD, bullying, anxiety, depression... Now I watch 
Ellen everyday and she's become my new idol, helping me get through 
everyday. I'd always answered "Robin" when people asked me the celebrity 
I'd like to meet. Now, one day, I'll meet Ellen and tell her my 
story. Thank you so much, Ellen.﻿

comments.text:
Its sad to say this but after watching more recent interviews before his 
passing and his past ones he was more closed off. He was still funny but 
you could tell that something was weighing him down. Still is shocking that 
someone who can have a profound effect on people are the ones going through 
the most emotional turmoil.
I can say this with a smile though he is a major influence on how i look at 
life and i always start with a smile and that can make a lot of stuff 
better than they were. Robin hope to see you in paradise my friend. R.I.P. 
Robin Williams.﻿

can learn to be a sparkle of the laughter he gifted us all for so many
